Module WitchHunt
Package fr.sos.witchhunt.model.players

Class HumanPlayer

java.lang.Object
fr.sos.witchhunt.model.players.Player
fr.sos.witchhunt.model.players.HumanPlayer
All Implemented Interfaces:
PlayerDisplayRequester, PlayerInputRequester, Resettable, Visitable
public final class HumanPlayer extends Player implements PlayerInputRequester

This class represents a human-controlled player.

It overrides all of Player's abstract methods, so that all choices a HumanPlayer can be led to make are based on user-input.

All required input methods are specified in the PlayerInputRequester interface.

See Also:
  • Player
  • PlayerInputRequester

    • choose

      private <T> T choose(List<T> from, String prompt)

      Chooses an object within a list of plural objects of a given and unique type.

      This method is made for the human players to select an element from a list of elements of a given type (using genericity).

      <T> Is the type of the objects in the list. Could be RumourCard, Player ...

      Parameters:
      from - The list of objects of type <T>
      prompt - The message to be displayed with the input request
      Returns:
      An unique object of type <T>, belonging to the list given in parameters
      See Also:
      • Menu
      • PlayerInputRequester.makeChoice(Menu)
      • chooseRevealedCard(RumourCardsPile)
      • chooseUnrevealedCard(RumourCardsPile, boolean)
      • chooseAnyCard(RumourCardsPile, boolean)
      • selectCardToDiscard(RumourCardsPile)

    • chooseNextPlayer

      public Player chooseNextPlayer()

      Elects the player who is going to take the next turn, based on user-input.

      Called by certain Rumour cards' effects, like the Ducking Stool's Witch? effect for example.

      Specified by:
      chooseNextPlayer in class Player
      Returns:
      The Player who was chosen to take the next turn
      See Also:
      • choose(List, String)
      • Player.takeNextTurn()
      • Round.setNextPlayer(Player)

    • chooseTurnAction

      public TurnAction chooseTurnAction()

      Chooses an action to perform during the player's turn, based on user-input.

      Human players, like CPUPlayers, can accuse and hunt, but they also can choose between two other special actions, show their cards and show players ranking. The two latter actions do not put an end to the turn : once performed, the player is asked to choose an action again.

      Specified by:
      chooseTurnAction in class Player
      Returns:
      The selected action : TurnAction can be ACCUSE,HUNT, show your cards or show players ranking.
      See Also:
      • choose(List, String)
      • TurnAction
      • Player.accuse(Player)
      • Player.hunt()
      • showHand()
      • showRanking()
      • Player.playTurn()

    • chooseDefenseAction

      public DefenseAction chooseDefenseAction()

      Chooses an action to respond to an accusation or a Hunt! effect, based on user-input.

      When a player is accused, they can choose between playing a Witch? effect, if they can, and revealing their identity.

      When a player is targetted by certain Hunt! effect like that of DuckingStool, they can choose between revealing their identity and discarding one of their Rumour cards.

      Specified by:
      chooseDefenseAction in class Player
      Returns:
      A response among ACCUSE, REVEAL and DISCARD.
      See Also:
      • DefenseAction
      • Player.revealIdentity()
      • Player.witch()
      • Player.discard(RumourCard)
      • revealOrDiscard()
      • chooseDefenseAction()
      • CPUPlayer.chooseDefenseAction()

    • showHand

      public void showHand()

      Requests the Display Mediator to show all of the cards in the player's hand.

      Shows the unrevealed cards as if they were revealed.

      See Also:
      • DisplayMediator::showCards(Player)

    • showRanking

      private void showRanking()

      Requests the Display Mediator to show players ranking.

      Specific information about this player's score and position in the ranking can be displayed.

    • chooseCard

      private RumourCard chooseCard(RumourCardsPile from)
      Chooses a Rumour card among a given pile of Rumour card, based on user-input.

      Collects user-input but does not display anything except input error messages.

      Parameters:
      from - The pile of Rumour card within which a card must be chosen
      Returns:
      The chosen Rumour card

    • revealOrDiscard

      public DefenseAction revealOrDiscard()

      Chooses an action between revealing your identity and discarding a Rumour card from your hand.

      Called when targetted by the Ducking Stool card's Hunt! effect.

      For human controlled players, specific messages are requested to be displayed if one of these options is not available.

      Specified by:
      revealOrDiscard in class Player
      Returns:
      Either DefenseAction.REVEAL or DefenseAction.DISCARD
      See Also:
      • Player.revealOrDiscard()
